block.p: Michele Anne Alfano and Cory Theodore Berwanger were married yesterday evening at the Greentree Country Club in New Rochelle, N.Y. Rabbi Stephen D. Franklin performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Alfano-Berwanger, 32, is a designer at Walker Group/CNI, a New York architecture firm. She graduated from Union College in Schenectady, N.Y., and received a master's degree in architecture from the State University at Buffalo. This year, she and a colleague shared an award from the American Institute of Architects for the design of a pedestrian tunnel linking a train station and a department store in Fukuoka, Japan.
Michele Anne Alfano and Cory Theodore Berwanger were married yesterday evening at the Greentree Country Club in New Rochelle, N.Y. Rabbi Stephen D. Franklin performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Alfano-Berwanger, 32, is a designer at Walker Group/CNI, a New York architecture firm. She graduated from Union College in Schenectady, N.Y., and received a master's degree in architecture from the State University at Buffalo. This year, she and a colleague shared an award from the American Institute of Architects for the design of a pedestrian tunnel linking a train station and a department store in Fukuoka, Japan.

The bride is the daughter of Thea Alfano and Dr. Robert Alfano of Riverdale, the Bronx. Her father holds the rank of distinguished professor of science and engineering at City College and directs the New York State Center of Advanced Technology for Ultrafast Photonic Materials and Applications in Manhattan.

Mr. Berwanger, 36, is a senior management consultant at Deutsche Bank in New York. He graduated from Rutgers. He is a son of Sherrildine Hoffman of Clifton, N.J., and a stepson of Charles Hoffmann. Mr. Hoffman is a truck driver for Superior Carriers in Kenville, N.J.
